The Cost of Freedom | Links

This document compiles related online resources for the interested reader to further her exploration of the topics addressed in the book.

#projects and organizations, #books, #discuss

  • Projects and Organization

    There are many like-minded projects and organizations promoting free culture around the world. If you know interesting grassroots initiatives or diversity-supporting institutions, please send them to book@costoffreedom.cc.

    Browse projects:
    • A
    • C
    • D
    • E
    • F
    • G
    • H
    • L
    • N
    • P
    • R
    • S
    • T
    • U
    • V
    • Σ

    • A

      • Arduino is an open-source electronics platform based on easy-to-use hardware and software. It's intended for anyone making interactive projects.
      • Action-criticism-media is a media observatory, created in 1996, that seek to share theoretical and militant knowledge.

    • C

      • CQFD is a critic and experimental social newspaper, based in Marseille.
      • Ca la Fou is a post-capitalist eco-industrial colony in Catalonia.
      • The Collectif Anonyme is an anarchist winemaker collective ( introduction en français)
      • Creative Commons provides licenses to protect the commons.

    • D

      • D-CENT is a European project to promote Decentralized Community Empowerment Network Technologies
      • Dyne.org is a non-profit free software foundry with more than 10 years of expertise in developing tools and narratives for community empowerment.

    • E

      • Emergents is a podcast on the development of a new form of power inside our networked society: autonomous, anonymous, volatile and independent.
      • Enercoop est un fournisseur d'électricité mutualiste à production 100 % locale et renouvelable.

    • F

      • The Free Software Foundation promotes ethical and collective software creation

    • G

      • The GNU project develops a free/libre operating system since 1983

    • H

      • Hackerspaces.org is an informal network of community-operated spaces where people share their interest in tinkering with technology, meet and work on their projects, and learn from each other.

    • L

      • Là-bas si j'y suis is one of the most engaged, radical and unusual show in the French radio landscape
      • Libre Graphics Mag is a magazine for graphics designers using free software tools.
      • The LFO is an associative experimental place, dedicated to exchange and digital learning, based in Marseille.

    • N

      • Library, study room, martial arts, computing... Nosotros is the most non-profit meeting place of Athens. It's based in Exarchia.

    • P

      • Permaculture Tunisie organizes practical field workshops and discussion sessions on Permaculture and techniques.

    • R

      • Robin Hood Cooperative is a critique of the financial sector replicating the bets of large investors for the benefit of their micro-investor members.

    • S

      • Savoir Agir is an autonomous collective founded by Pierre Bourdieu to bring together researchers (sociologists mostly) involved in the movement of the unemployed, the undocumented, etc.
      • Shouka Records is a non-profit independent label, voluntarily managed and involved in the Tunisian electronic and free scene.

    • T

      • Tetraneutral is an associative ISP in Toulouse, France.

    • U

      • UBU is a unique repository of rare artistic materials ranging from audio to video and texts by famous contemporary artists.

    • V

      • Verktumea remains the ultimate and vital stage for free and DIY music scene in Umeå and whole Sweden.

    • Σ

      • ΣΧΟΛΕΙΟ is a free social and learning space in Thessaloniki. Works with open direct democratic procedures.

Further Readings

  • The Architecture of Open Source Applications
  • Autonomedia publishes books on radical media, politics and the arts that seek to transcend party lines, bottom lines and straight lines.
  • Binding Chaos, by Heather Marsh.
  • Dark Mountain offers a home for writing that matters.
  • Monochrom Print
  • Network Cultures Institute bookshelf
  • The Journal of Peer Production

Discussions

We'd love to hear from you! You can join a mailing-list: book@costoffreedom.cc. Contributors can be joined at people@costoffreedom.cc. An low-traffic announcement list suitable for journalists is also available at announce@costoffreedom.cc.

Bassel tweeted as @basselsafadi from 2008. A full transcript of his tweets up to his arrest on March, 15, 2012, is available. You may also want to follow @freebassel and @costfreedombook on Twitter. The #freebassel and #costoffreedom hashtags are used for sharing related contents.

You may find us idling on the Freenode IRC network, on the channel #costoffreedom.

Other places online and off-line mark the path of freedom:

  • Devuan Discourse is emerging from the conversation among users and developers of the Devuan GNU+Linux libre operating system
  • rohrpost Deutschsprachige Liste zur Kultur digitaler Medien und Netze
  • Hacker Tribes explore post-civilization on the UnCivilization mailing list
#costoffreedom Tweets
